clues.text: Pushing up daisies, rung down the curtain--one phrase John Cleese missed about the parrot was this, purchased agricultural land

Idiomatically, to suddenly lose your temper is to "fly" this way but originally, it just referred to loose ax heads

The Columbia

This word that often follows "run" comes from Malay for "to go on an unprovoked rampage"

The Muskegon
